title: Dual system
summary: In mathematics, a dual system, dual pair, or duality over a field K {\displaystyle \mathbb {K} } is a triple ( X , Y , b ) {\displaystyle (X,Y,b)} consisting of two vector spaces X {\displaystyle X} and Y {\displaystyle Y} over K {\displaystyle \mathbb {K} } and a non-degenerate bilinear map b : X × Y → K {\displaystyle b:X\times Y\to \mathbb {K} } . Duality theory, the study of dual systems, is part of functional analysis.
